question.text: During the formation of gametophytes and embryo in angiosperms, the cells undergo two types of cell divisions. The diagram given below is a representation of them. The red lines indicate their plane of division. What is the correct type of X and Y?

options.text: X is periclinal division, while Y is an anticlinal division
X is anticlinal division while Y is an periclinal division
Both X and Y are periclinal divisions
Both X and Y are anticlinal division

solution.text: Periclinal division is a type of division in which the plane of division is parallel to the plane of the tissue. Anticlinal division is a type of division in which the plane of division is perpendicular to the plane of the tissues. Due to the periclinal division, we get many rows of cells.
